page.title: 14NEW WATER TOWER REDDITCH
page.content: {The New Water Tower}was built in 1973 because of the new town of Redditch being built,and undergoing considerable growth. It had become increasingly obvious that existing reservoir storage would be totally inadequate to meet the needs of the new town. The old water tower had become obsolete in the 1950's. Built at Headless Cross,with a capacity of 250,000 gallons,it was designed to cater for the needs of present and future properties in the high level area. {The New Water Tower}consisted of a concrete cylindrical tower structure, very modern in outloook, and very different from the old tower.It also has a new reservoir for 8 million gallons. It stands as a landmark on the Redditch skyline.
